STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
April 1, 2022
Sara Miller
Child & Family Services of the Upper Peninsula
Suite 105
706 Chippewa Square
Marquette, MI 49855-4817
RE: License #: CB520201043
Child & Family Services of the Upper Peninsula
Suite 105
706 Chippewa Square
Marquette, MI 49855-4817
Dear Mrs. Miller:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
03/21/2022. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the
MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 12 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 395-2847
enclosure

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12310 Initial evaluation.
(4) An agency shall document placement specifications
consistent with the information contained in the evaluation.
The placement specifications shall include the following:
(a) Age
One of the three current foster home files reviewed contained an annual foster home
evaluation that did not include the age range as a part of the placement
specifications recommended in the evaluation. A generic statement was made to
include the same specifications without identifying the specifications.
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(4) An agency shall document placement specifications
consistent with the information contained in the
reevaluation. The placement specifications shall include all
of the following:
(c) Race,
Two of the three current foster home files reviewed contained an annual foster home
evaluation that did not include the race as a part of the placement specifications
recommended in the evaluation. In both instances a statement was made to
recommend no changes, but the specifications were not identified.
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and shall make a
licensing recommendation to the department at least 15
calendar days before the expiration date of the foster home
license.
4

Three of the three current foster home files reviewed included documentation that
indicated a recommendation was not made at least 15 calendar days before the
expiration date of the license. In the first example the expiration date was identified
as 02/02/2021 and the report for the recommendation was dated 02/16/2021. The
second example identified an expiration date of 01/21/2021 and the 3706 submitted
for the renewal was signed 01/13/2021. The third example had an identified
expiration date of 03/20/2021 and this license was closed 03/25/2021.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(h) A copy of the current children's foster home license
application and children's foster home licensing transaction
record documents from the certifying agency.
One of the three borrowed home records reviewed did not include a copy of the
current foster home application license. The most recent application was dated
05/13/2021 but a copy of this application was not in the borrowed home file.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(1) An agency shall do all of the following when anyone in the
agency receives information that relates to possible
noncompliance with any foster home rule:
(a) Submit a special investigation record to the department's
licensing authority within 5 working days in the manner
prescribed by the department.
Two of the two special evaluations reviewed indicated the 259 was not submitted to
the department within the 5 working days of the intake. In the first example the
intake date was identified as 10/09/2021 and the 259 was submitted 11/04/2021. In
the second example the intake date was identified as 07/07/2021 and the 259 was
submitted 07/19/2021.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(1) An agency shall do all of the following when anyone in the
agency receives information that relates to possible
noncompliance with any foster home rule:
(b) Initiate a special evaluation of the foster home as soon as
is indicated, based on the information received, but not later
than 7 calendar days after receipt of the information.
5

One of the two special evaluations reviewed indicated the special evaluation was not
initiated within the 7 calendar day time frame required by this rule. In this example
the intake date was identified as 10/09/2021 and it was initiated 11/04/2021.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(a) Provide the foster parent with a copy of the report
required by subrule (5) of this rule within 10 calendar days of its
completion.
Two of the two special evaluations reviewed did not include adequate
documentation the foster parent received a copy of the completed special evaluation
report as required by this rule. It was reported the foster parents received the
reports, but the required documentation for compliance was not uploaded into the
required information system.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(b) Inform the foster parent, in writing, that he or she has a
right to have his or her written response included as an
attachment to the report required by subrule (5) of this rule.
Two of the two special evaluations reviewed did not include adequate
documentation the foster parent was informed in writing they could have their written
response included as an attachment to the report. It was reported the agency has a
cover letter that is sent to the foster parent along with the completed report for
compliance with this rule, but a copy of the cover letter was not found in the required
information system.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(3) The agency shall document all of the following in the child's
record before a change of placement occurs:
(f) Notification to the parents, referral source, lawyer
guardian ad litem, and courts when applicable, of the change in
placement.
Two of the two discharged youth records reviewed contained incomplete
documentation to establish compliance with the notification requirements of this rule.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the
following:
MISEP 4.22 MiSACWIS (Commitment 22). DHHS will maintain an operational
statewide automated child welfare information system (“MiSACWIS”) which
6

will be the primary tracking system and satisfy federal reporting
requirements.
Some examples of documents/documentation that appeared to be completed but
were not appropriately uploaded into the required information system were 3
service plan reports, 3 PATP reports with signatures, FTM documentation
information, and signatures on one adoption summary document.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
All documents requiring signatures should be signed and dated.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
AND
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted an acceptable corrective action plan for the interim evaluation
completed 04/28/2021. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of that review
were rules 212(2)(d), 306(4), 326(1)(c), 418(2)(b), MISEP 6.33, FOM 722-06H, FOM
722-06B, Contract 2.16, and ADM 300. None of these were identified as repeat
noncompliance as a part of this renewal evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was a review of the areas of noncompliance cited
in the interim evaluation and a review of the progress in completing the corrective action
plan that was submitted. Key performance indicators were reviewed as well as an
assessment of disrupted placements.
Interviews
Only the Chief Administrator was involved in entrance and exit conferences as a result
of staff availability.
7

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
04/01/2022
________________________________________
Mark R. Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
April 1, 2022
________________________________________
Linda Tansil Date
Area Manager
